get.description: Gets all of the Alerts

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

parameters.name: triggerId
parameters.description: The Trigger Id by which to filter results.

parameters.name: inflate
parameters.description: If this flag is set to true, then Workflow objects otherwise referenced by a single Unique ID will be populated in full.

200.description: The list of Alerts.

post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Workflow component, that allow users to search for Alerts. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query string for the Workflow component.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

parameters.name: inflate
parameters.description: If this flag is set to true, then Workflow objects otherwise referenced by a single Unique ID will be populated in full.

200.description: The list of Alert results that match the query string.

get.description: Gets an Alert by its Id

parameters.name: alertId
parameters.description: The Id of the Alert to retrieve data for.

200.description: The Alert

get.description: Sends a simple GET Query for fetching lists of Piazza Data.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Datasets.

parameters.name: createdByJobId
parameters.description: Filter datasets that were created by a specific Job Id.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Filter for the username that published the service.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

post.description: Loads Data into the Piazza Core metadata holdings. Piazza can either host the Data, or reflect an external location where the data is stored. Data must be loaded into Piazza before core components such as the ServiceController, or other external services, are able to consume that Data.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The description, location, and metadata for the Data to be loaded into Piazza.

201.description: The Id of the Job created to handle the Loading of the Data.

post.summary: Load a Data File into Piazza
post.description: Loads a local user Data file into Piazza. This functions the same as /data endpoint, but a file is specified instead of a URI.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The description, location, and metadata for the Data to be loaded into Piazza. This is the identical model to the LoadJob as specified in the body of the /data request. It is only noted as a string type here because of a Swagger deficiency.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded.

201.description: The Id of the Job created to handle the Loading of the Data.

get.description: Sends a simple GET Query for fetching lists of Piazza Data for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Datasets.

parameters.name: createdByJobId
parameters.description: Filter datasets that were created by a specific Job Id.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

post.summary: Query Metadata in Piazza Data holdings
post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Search component, that allow users to search for loaded data. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords, spatial metadata, or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query string for the Search component.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

get.description: Reads all metadata for a Data item that has been previously loaded into Piazza.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: Id of the Data item to pull Metadata for.

200.description: Metadata describing the Data Item that matches the specified Data Id. Includes release metadata, and spatial metadata, etc.

put.description: This will update the metadata for a specific data item. Non-null values will overwrite. This will only update the corresponding 'metadata' field in the Data item. Spatial metadata, and file information cannot be updated. For cases where spatial metadata or file data needs to change, and re-load of the Data must be done.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: Id of the Data item to update the Metadata for.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The Resource Metadata object containing the updated metadata fields to write.

200.description: Confirmation that the Metadata has been updated.

delete.description: Deletes an entry to Data that has been previously loaded into Piazza. If the file was hosted by Piazza, then that file will also be deleted.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: Id of the Data item to Delete.

200.description: Message indicating confirmation of delete

get.summary: Obtain a list of all GIS Server Deployments held by Piazza.
get.description: Data can be made available through the Piazza GIS Server as WMS/WCS/WFS. This must be done through POSTing to the /deployment endpoint. This endpoint will return a list of all Deployed resources.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Deployments.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

post.summary: Obtain a GIS Server Deployment for a Data Resource object
post.description: Data that has been loaded into Piazza can be deployed to the GIS Server. This will copy the data to the GIS Server data directory (if needed), or point to the Piazza PostGIS; and then create a WMS/WCS/WFS layer (as available) for the service. Only data that has been internally hosted within Piazza can be deployed.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The Data Id and deployment information for creating the Deployment

201.description: The Job Id for the specified Deployment. This could be a long-running process to copy the data over to the GIS Server, so a new Job is spawned.

post.description: Creates a new DeploymentGroup Id that can be used in order to add some future set of Deployments into a single WMS layer.

201.description: Metadata about for the DeploymentGroup that has been created.

delete.description: Deletes a DeploymentGroup from the Piazza metadata, and the GIS server.

parameters.name: deploymentGroupId
parameters.description: deploymentGroupId

200.description: Successful deletion of DeploymentGroup.

get.description: Fetches the Metadata for a Piazza Deployment.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Id of the Deployment to Fetch

200.description: The metadata about the Deployment. Contains the unique Id of the Deployment; the Data Id that it represents; and server information regarding the access of the deployed service including the GetCapabilities document.

delete.description: If a user wishes to delete a Deployment before its lease time is up (and automatic deletion could take place) then this endpoint provides a way to do so manually.

parameters.name: deploymentId
parameters.description: Id of the Deployment to Delete.

200.description: Confirmation that the deployment has been deleted.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all Events

parameters.name: eventTypeName
parameters.description: The name of the EventType to filter by.

parameters.name: eventTypeId
parameters.description: The Id of the EventType to filter by.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of Events.

post.summary: Creates an Event for the EventType
post.description: Sends an Event to the Piazza workflow component

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The Event JSON object.

post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Workflow component, that allow users to search for Events. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query string for the Workflow component.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Event results that match the query string.

get.description: Gets an Event by its Id, that corresponds with the EventType

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The Event Id for the event to retrieve.

200.description: The requested Event

delete.description: Deletes a specific Event by Id

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the Event to delete.

200.description: Confirmation of Event deletion.

get.description: Returns all EventTypes

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The EventType name to select on.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

200.description: The list of EventTypes.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The EventType information. This defines the schema for the Events that must be followed.

post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Workflow component, that allow users to search for EventTypes. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query string for the Workflow component.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of EventType results that match the query string.

get.description: Gets an EventType by Id

parameters.name: eventTypeId
parameters.description: The unique Id for the EventType.

200.description: The EventType

delete.description: Deletes a specific EventType by Id

parameters.name: eventTypeId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the EventType to delete.

200.description: Confirmation of EventType deletion.

get.description: Gets the Bytes of Data loaded into Piazza. Only works for Data that is stored internally by Piazza.

parameters.name: dataId
parameters.description: The Id of the Data to download.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Specify the name of the file that the user wishes to retrieve the data as. This will set the content-disposition header.

200.description: The downloaded data file, byte array.

post.description: Creates a Piazza Job to execute a registered service in the system, with the specified parameters.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Payload that describes the Service to be executed, and the inputs for that service.

201.description: The Job Id for the execution of the Service. This can be queried using Job Status to track progress and, when available, fetch the result object.

get.description: Gets the Status for a Piazza Job by its Id.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the Job to Fetch

200.description: Information regarding the requested Job. At bare minimum, this will contain the Job Id of the Job that has been spawned as a result of the POSTed message. If more information is available, such as Status, it will also be included.

post.description: Repeats a previously submitted Job. This will clone the original Job, and run it again with identical parameters, using the requesting users authentication in the new Job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the Job to Repeat

201.description: A new Job Id that corresponds to the cloned Job in Piazza.

delete.description: Requests a Running Job to be cancelled. If the Job is already completed in some way, then cancellation will not occur.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Id of the Job to cancel.

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: Details for the cancellation of the Job.

200.description: The Job has requested to be cancelled. This may take some time, as the process may not be in an easily cancelled state at the time the request is made.

get.description: Gets the User Profile for the user based on provided API Key from Authentication block.

200.description: User Profile information.

get.description: Retrieves the list of available Services currently registered to this Piazza system.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Services.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Filter for the user name that published the service.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Services registered to Piazza.

post.description: Creates a new Service with the Piazza Service Controller; that can be invoked through Piazza jobs with Piazza data.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The metadata for the service. This includes the URL, parameters, inputs and outputs. It also includes other release metadata such as classification and availability.

201.description: The Id of the newly created Service

get.description: Retrieves the list of available Services currently registered to this Piazza system.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A general keyword search to apply to all Services.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Services registered to Piazza.

post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Search component, that allow users to search for registered Services. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords, spatial metadata, or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The Query string for the Search component.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Search results that match the query string.

get.description: Gets a Service by its Id

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The Id of the Service to retrieve.

200.description: The Service object.

put.description: Updates Service Metadata, to the Service specified by Id.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The Id of the Service to Update.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The Service Metadata. All properties specified in the Service data here will overwrite the existing properties of the Service.

200.description: Confirmation of Update.

delete.description: Unregisters a Service by its Id.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The Id of the Service to unregister.

parameters.name: softDelete
parameters.description: Determines if the Service should be completely removed, or just disabled. If set to false, the Service will be entirely deleted.

200.description: Confirmation of Deleted.

post.summary: Get Next Job in Service's Job Queue
post.description: For the specified Service, assuming it was registed as a Task-Managed Service, this will retrieve the next Job off of that Service's Jobs Queue.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The Id of the Service whose Queue to retrieve a Job from.

200.description: The payload containing the Job information, including input and Id.

get.description: Returns specific metadata on the current Job Queue for a Task-Managed Service, such as the number of jobs currently in the queue.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: serviceId

200.description: Metadata information

post.summary: Update Job information for the specified Service.
post.description: Allows for updating of Status (including Results) for Jobs handled by a Task-Managed User Service

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The Id of the Service whose Job to Update.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The Id of the Job whose Status to Update.

parameters.name: statusUpdate
parameters.description: The contents of the Status Update.

200.description: OK message stating the update succeeded

get.description: Returns an array of Triggers

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large numbers of results. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Triggers.

parameters.name: trigger
parameters.description: The Trigger information to register. This defines the Conditions that must be hit in order for some Action to occur.

post.description: Sends a complex query message to the Piazza Workflow component, that allow users to search for Triggers. Searching is capable of filtering by keywords or other dynamic information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query string for the Workflow component.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Paginating large datasets. This will determine the starting page for the query.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned per query.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Indicates ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The data field to sort by.

200.description: The list of Trigger results that match the query string.

get.description: Gets a Trigger by its Id.

parameters.name: triggerId
parameters.description: The Id of the Trigger to retrieve.

200.description: The Trigger definition matching the specified Trigger Id

put.description: This will update the Trigger to either be enabled or disabled.

parameters.name: triggerId
parameters.description: Id of the Trigger to update

parameters.name: triggerUpdate
parameters.description: The object containing the boolean field to enable or disable

200.description: Confirmation that the Trigger has been updated.

delete.description: Deletes a Trigger. This Trigger will no longer listen for conditions for events to fire.

parameters.name: triggerId
parameters.description: The Id of the Trigger to delete.

200.description: Message indicating Trigger was deleted successfully

get.description: Gets the current API Key based on the provided Authentication block. Will not create a new key.

200.description: API Key information.

post.description: Creates a new Piazza API Key based on the Authentication block. This creates a new Key and overrides any previous keys.

200.description: API Key information.

content.description: The text content of the Data

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data.  Refer to http://www.iana.org for standard values

eventTypeId.description: The unique Id of this EventType. Not used in POST requests

mapping.description: The map of key-value pairs that define the properties of this EventType. The key is the name of the property, and the value is the type of that property. Valid types are 'string', 'boolean', 'integer', 'double' 'date', 'float', 'short', 'long' and 'byte''

name.description: A human-readable name for this EventType

uuid.description: Contains the Id for the requested user

message.description: A description of the error describing the failure

statusCode.description: Specific statusCode for errors if available

capabilitiesUrl.description: Fully qualified URL for accessing the GetCapabilities action for the Deployment service

dataId.description: The unique Id of the Data that this Deployment hosts

deploymentId.description: The unique Id for this Deployment

host.description: The host name for the Deployment server

layer.description: The layer name for the hosted service on the Deployment server

port.description: The port number for the Deployment server

data.description: The Object containing the Service Id
The Service Job Metadata.

count.description: The number of results that matched the query

order.description: The order of the results. Either 'asc' or 'desc' for ascending or descending

perPage.description: The current number of results returned per page

sortBy.description: The field that the data is being sorted by

data.description: The array of Service results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

condition.description: Elastic Search DSL Query 2.2, for details see https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/2.2/query-dsl.html

enabled.description: Field that will determine if the trigger fires

eventTypeId.description: The EventTypeId of the EventType to run the query for

job.description: The template of the Job to be executed when the conditions are met

name.description: The description of what this Trigger intends to accomplish

triggerId.description: The unique Id for this Trigger. Not used in POST requests

content.description: The text content of the Data

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data.  Refer to http://www.iana.org for standard values

jobId.description: The Id of the associated Job that encountered an Error

message.description: A description of the error describing the failure

origin.description: The Piazza component where the error originated

content.description: The text content of the Data

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data.  Refer to http://www.iana.org for standard values

data.description: The Description of the Data being loaded, including metadata, and the path to the Data

host.description: Dictates if Piazza should internally host the Data or not. If set to true, then the Data will be stored in Piazza's Data holdings. If false, then Piazza will point to the location of the Data, but will not store the Data internally

data.description: Contains the Job Status Information
Object describing the nature of the action that took place

jobId.description: The Id of the Job referenced in the request

databaseTableName.description: The name of the database table holding the Data

geoJsonContent.description: The GeoJSON content of the Data

location.description: The location of the Data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the Data is located

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data.  Refer to http://www.iana.org for standard values

fileName.description: The name of the file stored

filePath.description: The path to the file on the shared folder

fileSize.description: The size of the file stored, in bytes

jobId.description: The Id of the Job referenced in the request

createdBy.description: The user that submitted the job

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data

deployment.description: Object containing metadata regarding a Piazza Deployment

serviceId.description: The Id of the Service referenced in the request

data.description: The array of Alert results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

data.description: Object containing metadata regarding a Piazza DeploymentGroup

progress.description: The Progress information of the Job, including time spent/remaining, or percentage complete.

result.description: The Result object of this Job.

database.description: The name of the database hosting the Data

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data

table.description: The name of the database table holding the Data

jobId.description: The Id of the subject Job

reason.description: The reason given for aborting the Job

createdBy.description: The name of the user who submitted the Job

createdOn.description: The time the Job was requested.

executedServiceId.description: If a Service Job, this will contain the Id of the Service that was executed.

jobType.description: Polymorphically describes the information defining what actions this Job should take

progress.description: Object containing metadata describing the current status of the Job

result.description: A reference to the Result of the Job. This could be a Resource Id, or a Service Id, in certain cases. Or perhaps an error if the Job encountered an error during processing

status.description: The status of the Job. Submitted, Running, Success, Error, or Failure

data.description: The array of Deployment results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

featureType.description: The type of geospatial feature represented in the Data

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data

url.description: HTTP web address to the WFS endpoint

version.description: The current version of the Data

enabled.description: Field that will determine if the trigger fires

percentComplete.description: The percentage complete for the Job, in whole numbers, out of 100 percent

timeRemaining.description: The last value for the Time Remaining as reported by the processor of this Job

timeSpent.description: The amount of time spent by the processor of this Job, according to that processor

location.description: The location of the Data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the Data is located

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data

query.description: Elastic Search DSL Query 2.2, for details see https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/2.2/query-dsl.html

deployment.description: The Deployment metadata, including GIS Server URL to access the data

expiresOn.description: If one exists, the date at which this Deployment may be subject to automatic resource cleanup on the Piazza GIS Server

data.description: The array of Data Resource results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

data.description: The Object containing the User Profile.
The array of Event results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

data.description: The Object containing the Job Id
The array of Trigger results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

availability.description: Describes the status of the resource(ONLINE, FAILED (The resoure has failed), DEGRADED (The resource is not performing well), OFFLINE (the resource has been turned off)

clientCertRequired.description: Indication on whether a client certificate required to access thie resource.  Could be a user certificate or computer certificate

contacts.description: Name, e-mail and phone number of point of contact (String concatenated together)

createdBy.description: Username of the individual submitting the resource

createdByJobId.description: Provided by the system. If available, the Id of the Job that resulted in the creation of this resource.

createdOn.description: The date and time of data submission to Piazza

credentialsRequired.description: Indication on whether credentials are required to access this resource

format.description: In case of ComplexData, Format defines the allowed input representation

metadata.description: A generic Map of String:String (key:value) pairs with additional metadata

networkAvailable.description: A list of networks names where this resource is available

numericKeyValueList.description: Allows for the optional specification of user-defined key-value pairs of numeric values

preAuthRequired.description: Indication on whether preauthorization is required before using the resource?  (e.g. do users need to sign a user agreement, etc.)

qos.description: Quality level of the resource (Production, Development)

reason.description: Human readable reason on the status of the resource

textKeyValueList.description: Allows for the optional specification ofu ser-defined key-value pairs for string values

version.description: The current version of the resource

classification.description: The security classification marking for the Data

location.description: The location of the Data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the Data is located

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data

data.description: Object containing information regarding a Piazza Service
Object containing information regarding a Piazza Event
The parameter inputs for Service execution

jobId.description: Specified by the system. The Job Id created for executing the Service
The Id of the subject Job

dataId.description: The unique Id of the Data resource

databaseTableName.description: The PostGIS table name that contains the Shapefile Data

location.description: The location of the Data. Used to describe S3 stores, or folder shares, for where the Data is located

mimeType.description: The media type of the stored Data

text.description: The text content of the Data

data.description: Object containing information regarding a Piazza EventType

message.description: A description of the successful operation performed

origin.description: The Piazza component where the message originated

coordinateReferenceSystem.description: The CRS (Coordinate Reference System) of the data

epsgCode.description: The EPSG code of the CRS

maxX.description: The maximum X ordinate of the bounding box

maxY.description: The maximum Y ordinate of the bounding box

maxZ.description: The maximum Z ordinate of the bounding box

minX.description: The minimum X ordinate of the bounding box

minY.description: The minimum Y ordinate of the bounding box

minZ.description: The minimum Z ordinate of the bounding box

numFeatures.description: The number of features contained in the resource

projectedSpatialMetadata.description: Supplied by the System. If populated, this contains the spatial bounding box of the dataset in a reprojection to WGS84 (EPSG 4326)

data.description: Object containing metadata describing the Data

contractUrl.description: URL to the schema or contract to interface with the Service, such as a Swagger file, or documentation

heartbeat.description: The frequency in which Piazza sends heartbeat requests to check on the health of the Service  (defaults to 120 seconds)

isAsynchronous.description: Determines if this User Service is a long-running service that supports asynchronous endpoints, or if this is a synchronous service that returns results directly. If `isTaskManaged` is set to `true`, then this value is ignored.

isTaskManaged.description: Determines if this User Service uses Piazza Task Management as a Service functionality. If this value is set to true, then the `isSynchronous` value is ignored.

method.description: The HTTP Method used to invoke this User Service. For Asynchronous Services, this applies only to the Execution endpoint.

resourceMetadata.description: Object of common metadata fields used to describe Data or Services within the Piazza system

serviceId.description: Provided by the System. The unique Id of the Service

taskAdministrators.description: The list of Piazza user names (not API Keys) who are able to administrate this services Task Management capabilities. By default, the user registering the service will have these privelages. This user list is only applicable if `isTaskManaged` is set to `true`.

timeout.description: The timeout in seconds Piazza waits for a response (defaults to 600 seconds)

url.description: The URL to the user Service to be executed. This is *optional* for Task Managed services, and rqeuired for all other types.

dataId.description: Provided by the System. The unique Id of the Data

dataType.description: Polymorphically defines the information specific to this Data Resource, based on its format

metadata.description: Object of common metadata fields used to describe Data or Services within the Piazza system

spatialMetadata.description: Supplied by the System. Object of spatial metadata fields associated with a Resource. Used to generically specify the bounding box and the spatial reference of a dataset in its native projection system

data.description: The array of EventType results

pagination.description: The pagination metadata for this query

message.description: A description of the error describing the failure

origin.description: The Piazza component where the error originated

dataId.description: The unique Id of the Data resource

serviceId.description: The Id of the Service to Execute

dataId.description: The Id of the subject Data

deploymentGroupId.description: Optional. If provided, the Deployment will also be added to the specified DeploymentGroup

deploymentType.description: The type of Deployment, such as hosted on a Piazza GIS Server instance. Currently, the only acceptable value for this is 'geoserver'

durationDays.description: Optional. The number of days that this Deployment will be needed for. Once the Deployment expires, it is subject to automatic resource cleanup on the Piazza GIS Server

data.description: Contains the Deployment and the Expiration Date

cronSchedule.description: Optional. The cron expression representing the schedule at which this event will be repeated

data.description: The populated values for the Key-value pairs defined by the EventType's 'mapping' dictionary. Each value in this dictionary must be populated here under this 'data' property

eventId.description: The unique Id for this Event.  Not used in POST requests

eventTypeId.description: The unique Id of the EventType whose schema this Event conforms to

alertId.description: The unique Id for this Alert

eventId.description: The unique Id for the Event that fired the Trigger

jobId.description: The unique Id for the Job that was submitted

triggerId.description: The unique Id for the Trigger that was fired

data.description: Object containing information regarding a Piazza Trigger

bucketName.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket hosting the data

domainName.description: The name of the domain in the Amazon S3 URL hosting the data

fileName.description: The name of the file stored

fileSize.description: The size of the file stored, in bytes

createdBy.description: The user who created this DeploymentGroup

deploymentGroupId.description: The unique identifier for this DeploymentGroup

hasGisServerLayer.description: Determines if the GIS Server instance has a corresponding Layer Group for this DeploymentGroup
